sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix, which we'll call D. The coefficient matrix is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & -2 & 1 \\
2 & 4 & -3 \\
1 & 1 & 1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

The determinant D is calculated as follows:

$$
D = 3\begin{vmatrix}
4 & -3 \\
1 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix} - (-2)\begin{vmatrix}
2 & -3 \\
1 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix} + 1\begin{vmatrix}
2 & 4 \\
1 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix}
$$

$$
D = 3(4(1) - (-3)(1)) - (-2)(2(1) - (-3)(1)) + 1(2(1) - 4(1))
$$

$$
D = 3(4 + 3) + 2(2 + 3) - 2
$$

$$
D = 3(7) + 2(5) - 2
$$

$$
D = 21 + 10 - 2
$$

$$
D = 29
$$

Now, we'll find the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing the columns of the coefficient matrix with the constant terms of the given system of equations. We'll call these determinants Dx, Dy, and Dz.

For Dx, replace the first column with the constant terms:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
10 & -2 & 1 \\
-5 & 4 & -3 \\
4 & 1 & 1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Calculate the determinant Dx:

$$
Dx = 10\begin{vmatrix}
4 & -3 \\
1 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix} - (-2)\begin{vmatrix}
-5 & -3 \\
4 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix} + 1\begin{vmatrix}
-5 & 4 \\
4 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix}
$$

$$
Dx = 10(4(1) - (-3)(1)) + 2(5(1) - (-3)(4)) + 1(-5(1) - 4(4))
$$

$$
Dx = 10(4 + 3) + 2(5 + 12) - 21
$$

$$
Dx = 10(7) + 2(17) - 21
$$

$$
Dx = 70 + 34 - 21
$$

$$
Dx = 83
$$

For Dy, replace the second column with the constant terms:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 10 & 1 \\
2 & -5 & -3 \\
1 & 4 & 1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Calculate the determinant Dy:

$$
Dy = 3\begin{vmatrix}
-5 & -3 \\
4 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix} - 10\begin{vmatrix}
2 & -3 \\
1 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix} + 1\begin{vmatrix}
2 & -5 \\
1 & 4 \\
\end{vmatrix}
$$

$$
Dy = 3(-5(1) - (-3)(4)) - 10(2(1) - (-3)(1)) + 1(2(4) - 5(1))
$$

$$
Dy = 3(-5 + 12) - 10(2 + 3) + 1(8 - 5)
$$

$$
Dy = 3(7) - 10(5) + 3
$$

$$
Dy = 21 - 50 + 3
$$

$$
Dy = -26
$$

For Dz, replace the third column with the constant terms:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & -2 & 10 \\
2 & 4 & -5 \\
1 & 1 & 4 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Calculate the determinant Dz:

$$
Dz = 3\begin{vmatrix}
4 & -5 \\
1 & 4 \\
\end{vmatrix} - (-2)\begin{vmatrix}
2 & -5 \\
1 & 4 \\
\end{vmatrix} + 10\begin{vmatrix}
2 & 4 \\
1 & 1 \\
\end{vmatrix}
$$

$$
Dz = 3(4(4) - (-5)(1)) + 2(2(4) - (-5)(1)) + 10(2(1) - 4(1))
$$

$$
Dz = 3(16 + 5) + 2(8 + 5) - 20
$$

$$
Dz = 3(21) + 2(13) - 20
$$

$$
Dz = 63 + 26 - 20
$$

$$
Dz = 69
$$

Now, we can find the values of x, y, and z using Cramer's rule:

$$
x = \frac{Dx}{D} = \frac{83}{29} = 3
$$

$$
y = \frac{Dy}{D} = \frac{-26}{29} = -1
$$

$$
z = \frac{Dz}{D} = \frac{69}{29} = 2
$$

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is:

$$
x = 3, \ y = -1, \ z = 2
$$
